data: Hypoglycemia: for blood glucose below 4 mmol/L
If patient conscious and able to swallow
If/when blood glucose is below 4 mmol/L, then refer to the Adult Hypoglycemia Algorithm for the conscious patient
If patient unconscious and unable to swallow
If/when blood glucose is below 4 mmol/L, then refer to the Adult Hypoglycemia Algorithm for the unconscious patient
q15min for 30 min or until capillary blood glucose is above 4 mmol/L
Do NOT hold scheduled basal insulin injections unless specifically approved by most responsible physician
After 1 hour for blood glucose above 4 mmol/L and after intervention
If capillary blood glucose is below 4 mmol/L after 2 capillary blood glucose readings
250 mL, IV, once, drug form: bag
125 mL, IV, once, drug form: bag
12.5 g = 25 mL, IV, q15min PRN,  hypoglycemia, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: syringe-inj
20 g, PO, once, PRN hypoglycemia, drug form: tab
28 g, PO, once, PRN hypoglycemia, drug form: tab
0.5 mg, subcutaneous, q15min PRN, hypoglycemia, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: kit
1 mg, subcutaneous, q 15min PRN, hypoglycemia, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: kit
Reason for Consult: Other (see special instructions), hypoglycemia (Powerplan)
